text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today 
I want to share with you a recipe for a really

simple vegetable side dish now it's so simple 
that you're probably not gonna believe me that

it's that good but trust me this dish is super 
popular in Thailand right now because it's so

good I'm talking about something called galam 
plee pad nampla galam plee is cabbage Pad

means to stir-fry and nampla is fish sauce 
and just by the name I've almost given you the

entire recipe it's that simple all right let's 
get started so for the cabbage you want to use

green cabbage for this and I've just cut them 
into sort of like squares like that now the

cabbage that I like to use is actually an Asian 
style cabbage where they're little more squat so

this is like a quarter of a cabbage right 
here I know it's like the biggest cabbage

I've ever seen in my life but you know instead 
of being round like a ball it's more flat like

this so this is the remainder of it so but 
you can totally use a regular round one it's

just that I personally prefer these I find the 
leaves are a little bit more delicate and now

the garlic so you want lots and lots of garlic 
for this recipe and I'm gonna show you what sort

of how I process these for this recipe if I want 
them smashed and not chopped because I like that

chunky you want that chunky pieces of garlic in 
there so I just take my pestle here and you can

use something else that's heavy and smash them 
and then you can peel them as well easily right

and then I smash it down a little bit more oops 
so that they break up into pieces like this and

this way they're so bruised that the flavor 
really comes out easily but when you eat it

once it's been cooked it's soft and garlicky mmm 
so good so when I do this to the rest of my garlic

and now of course the fish sauce the number I 
so this is the time you want to pull out your

best your most luxurious your most delicious 
premium fish sauce and if you've seen my fish

sauce tasting video you know that my favorite 
one is this red boat one it is more expensive

but it really is premium quality and this 
dish will be one where you can really taste

it because it's the only seasoning we're gonna 
use apart from that I've got some white pepper

just for a little subtle heat you don't have 
to do it you can do black pepper if you want

if you want to make it spicy you can add a 
little bit Thai chilies but really this is

all there is to it let's get cooking okay so 
heat on not too high at this point some oil in

there and right away I'm gonna add my garlic 
and I want to add the garlic when the oil is

not super hot so the garlic has time to slowly 
infuse the flavor in there if your oil is hot

and you add the garlic it's like instantly turns 
golden and you don't have time to really soften

the garlic which is what you want for this 
so I'll tell you a secret this is actually

the second time I've had to film this recipe 
because the first time Adam insisted on having

one more close-up of the garlic and he cost me 
to burn the garlic yeah so I'm very upset so now

that the garlic's starting to turn golden brown 
around the edges in goes the cabbage quick spot
and then the fish sauce

and the pepper and that's it now you're gonna just 
continue to toss this around until the cabbage is

wilted really at this point to your liking you 
want a nice and crisp oh you want a nice and

stuff take it as far as you want and you can crank 
the heat up at this point as well all right and

I think I am happy with that the thinner pieces 
are translucent so nice and crisp on the bigger

pieces off heat and we're done I know now you're 
thinking what that it this can't be good but now

when you try it you're gonna be like oh my god 
it's brilliant and you're gonna thank me because

it's so simple so budget-friendly to don't have 
to plan anything ahead of time now if you think

this looks a little bit ho-hum and you want a 
little something something you can do green onion

sprinkle do whatever you can just do like a little 
bit of like a black pepper crack in the middle you

know give it a little jazz it up a little but most 
of the time this is probably not gonna be the only

thing you're having for dinner it's gonna be a 
nice side dish but like a chicken stir-fry or like

something like a barbecue chicken or something but 
I'm gonna taste it as is have this with rice of

course Thai style we always eat everything with 
rice I want to make sure I get some garlic on

there I just have to comment that even though fish 
sauce is the only thing in this dish once you've

cooked it and everything it no longer smells 
fishy like not at all and this is the wonderful

thing about fish sauce right when you cook it 
it just it just transforms into something else

all that garlic so good incredible simple 
goodness the cabbage has a natural sweetness

to it so we didn't need to add any sugar at all 
and the fish sauce because it's good quality fish

sauce it's so it's got such a rich mommy flavor 
but it's really quite incredible then like that

comes from one ingredient so good I mean this 
is that simple as it gets this is like a rustic

Thai home cooking right here if you want to know 
what Thai people eat on a Wednesday night it's

something like this and it's so delicious so I 
hope you give this a try the recipe as always

will be on hot Thai kitchen calm and do send me 
a photo once you've made it on Facebook Twitter

or Instagram and if you haven't subscribed 
to the show make sure you do so you don't

miss an episode like this and click the little 
bell icon also so you get a notification when

I post a new video if you love the show and you 
want to support us please check out our patreon

link in the description box below and I will 
see you next time for your next edition time
